3. Similarly, if I always choose B and my opponent chooses R, I get $42 each round, while they get nothing, totaling $3150 ($42*75), making me $2250 worse off compared to when we both choose R.

4. If I always choose B and my opponent also chooses B, I earn $12 per round, totaling $900 ($12*75) over 75 rounds. So in this case, my earnings are $2475 less than if we both chose R.

Considering all possibilities, it's clear that choosing R results in higher earnings compared to choosing B in this game. Therefore, my choice would be to pick R ({R}).
